    Class: XOR

    Defined in: src/combine.iced
    Inherits: CombineBase

    Overview

    The XOR HMAC combiner. Good when you are shooting for PRF-qualities.

    Class Method Summary

    • + (void) get_output_size() The default output size if you use the default arguments, which is Math.min(HMAC(SHA512), HMAC(SHA3))
    • + (WordArray) sign({key, input}) Sign an input with the given key using this technique.
    • + (void) bulk_sign(arg, cb) Sign using the bulk async callback-based interface.

    Instance Method Summary

    • - (void) constructor(key, klasses = [SHA512, SHA3]) Constructor
    • - (void) reset() When resetting and reinitializing an XOR-HMAC-combiner, take the extra precaution of putting a 0,1,2,3....
    • - (Number) get_output_size() Gets the output size of this combination, which can only be known once this Combiner has been allocated.

    Inherited Method Summary

    Methods inherited from CombineBase

    #constructor, #reset, #update, #scrub, #finalize

    Class Method Details

    + (void) get_output_size()

    The default output size if you use the default arguments, which is Math.min(HMAC(SHA512), HMAC(SHA3))

    + (WordArray) sign({key, input})

    Sign an input with the given key using this technique.

    Parameters:

    • key (WordArray) — The key to sign with.
    • input (WordArray) — The input data to sign.

    Returns:

    • (WordArray) — the HMAC signatures

    + (void) bulk_sign(arg, cb)

    Sign using the bulk async callback-based interface.

    Parameters:

    • cb (callback) — Calls back with a signature as a WordArray

    Options Hash: (arg):

    • key (WordArray) — The key to use for signing.
    • input (WordArray) — The input to sign
    • progress_hook (Function) — A standard progress hook

    Constructor Details

    - (void) constructor(key, klasses = [SHA512, SHA3])

    Parameters:

    • key (WordArray) — The key to use, repeated for each klass
    • klasses (Vector<Class>) — The classes to combine.

    Instance Method Details

    - (void) reset()

    When resetting and reinitializing an XOR-HMAC-combiner, take the extra precaution of putting a 0,1,2,3.... into the inner HMACs, so that even if the same HMAC is used, we don't get zero.

    - (Number) get_output_size()

    Gets the output size of this combination, which can only be known once this Combiner has been allocated. Call this if you're not using the default Class parameters (SHA512 + SHA3).

    Returns:

    • (Number) — The output size in bytes.
